meanings.definition: To pay or provide for (expenses, costs, etc.)
meanings.sent1: She defrayed the dinner bill for her friends.
meanings.sent2: The company defrayed the travel expenses for its employees.
meanings.sent3: The generous uncle defrayed the ice cream costs for the kids.
meanings.sent4: Her scholarship defrayed the burden of tuition fees.
meanings.sent5: The fundraiser defrayed the medical expenses for the community.

meanings.definition: To bear or pay all or part of (the costs, expenses, etc.)
meanings.sent1: He defrayed the repair costs of the car.
meanings.sent2: The organization defrayed the construction expenses of the new building.
meanings.sent3: The superhero defrayed the damages caused by the villain's attack.
meanings.sent4: The insurance policy defrayed the financial burden of the accident.
meanings.sent5: The scholarship defrayed the educational expenses for the student.
